attributes.action: Add drain nets to waste drainage systems to stop plastic from entering the sea.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ibelieveinmothernature.com/my-world/australia-found-a-simple-way-to-save-water-from-plastic-pollution-and-we-can-start-doing-the-same/

'The new system of filtration managed to collect more than 800 pounds of garbage for a few weeks only.'
attributes.background: After seeing this tested by Australia, I believe it's time we take further action in saving our planet. Unessary amounts of plastic are entering our seas every single day, and this could be a great step in the right direction. A small change to our drains could make a huge difference to the world.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because this would be a decision for the owners of the waste drainage systems and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about who is responsible for waste drainage systems here:

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/nonhouseholds/supply-and-standards/public-and-private-sewers/

You could start a new petition calling for the Government to fund a pilot system of drain nets if that is something you would like to see happen.
